result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael M Rennells was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 04-15-2016 or serve 14 days jail, consecutive, as penalty for non payment of fine.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael M Rennells

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael M Rennells in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to count # 1. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #1. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Perkins makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. Defendant sentenced to the following. 

COUNT #1:

FINE: $505.00 + $200.00 DNA surcharge. (to be paid at $50.00 /month commencing (04/15/16) or serve 14 days jail, consecutive, as penalty for non payment of fine)

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michael M Rennells in court with Attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Perkins requests a plea and sentence date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Michael M Rennells in court.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he still wishes to obtain counsel. Court adjourns.  Defendant to see public defender's office.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with Dominic B listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Michael M Rennells in court.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 10:30 am.
